definition: to confer a favor on sb/to confer a benefit
to grant/to give/to bestow/to act/to carry out

sentences.english: Think about all the good you do each day, and the ways that you enrich others.
sentences.chinese: 想下你每天做的善行和你施恩于别人的方式。

sentences.english: All they had were memories of the days when God's favor was on them.
sentences.chinese: 他们一无所有，只剩下上帝向他们施恩时的回忆。

sentences.english: and thereby shall I know that thou hast shewed kindness unto my master.
sentences.chinese: 这样，我便知道你施恩给我主人了。

sentences.english: They simply forgot God's goodness to them and murmured against God.
sentences.chinese: 他们完全忘记了神的施恩，只懂得抱怨神。

sentences.english: Care for my family just the same.
sentences.chinese: 以基督之名祷告，愿同样施恩于我的家人。

sentences.english: Let not your hand be shut when you should repay.
sentences.chinese: 不要在必须施恩时，收回你的双手。

sentences.english: And the king granted me, according to the good hand of my God upon me.
sentences.chinese: 王就允准我，因我神施恩的手帮助我。

sentences.english: But when God, who set me apart from birth and called me by his grace, was pleased.
sentences.chinese: 然而那把我从母腹里分别出来，又施恩召我的神。

sentences.english: And Jesus focused on her as a target for his grace.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣注目在她身上，要向她施恩。

sentences.english: To give is more blessed than to receive.
But when it pleased God, who separated me from my mother's womb, and called me by his grace.
sentences.chinese: 然而那把我从母腹里分别出来，又施恩召我的神。

sentences.english: By this I will know that you have shown kindness to my master.
sentences.chinese: 这样，我便知道你施恩给我主人了。

sentences.english: Have mercy on me, and lift me up out of the pit of depression.
sentences.chinese: 求你施恩怜悯我，将我从抑郁的深坑中拉上来。

sentences.english: He made the atonement cover of pure gold-two and a half cubits long and a cubit and a half wide.
sentences.chinese: 用精金作施恩座，长二寸半，宽一寸半。
上主对人只会慈悲施恩。

sentences.english: The chieftain of that country is disguised as a benefactor this time.
sentences.chinese: 那个国家的首领这一次伪装出一副施恩者的姿态。

definition: to pardon/to absolve/to exempt from punishment
grateful and seeking to repay the kindness (idiom)
to make a concession/to be accommodating
